result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Kasey L. Freeman was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Cases 14CF230 & 14CF264 called together at 2:20 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kasey L. Freeman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF230:
Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" & "Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty but Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2 & #3 and case 14CF264

Court orders Mr. Freeman committed to DHS for 3 years and orders DHS to prepare recommendation on if this shall be supervised release or in-patient, due in 45 days. Until that decision is made, Mr. Freeman to remain in community.

case called at 1:17pm. 
Defendant Kasey L. Freeman appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Freeman confirms that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are accurate.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to drive a motor vehicle  
-Mr. Freeman is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on Thursday, July 10th at 1:30pm. 

During its designation of scheduling, the Court orders Mr. Freeman to personally appear at the July 23rd Pretrial Conference, however Attorney De La Rosa requests that the Court reconsider this order due to Mr. Freeman's bond-prohibition against driving. 
Thereafter the Court orders Mr. Freeman to:  check in at the Fort Atkinson Police Department at July 23, 2014 at 9:20am to let them know he is in town and sober and where he should be. 
recess 1:30pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/23/14 at 9:20am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 8/1/14 at 8:30am.
